Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1

Over on the hypermedia-web group there was a recent thread [1] asking for
examples of hypermedia APIs "in the wild".  I replied and described a
little about Restful Objects, something I've been working on a lot recently.

InfoQ have now published an introductory article on Restful Objects at
InfoQ [2].  It went up yesterday; there has also been some interesting
follow-up discussion.

Since (I believe) the ideas in the article challenge some commonly held
views; I'd be interested in any reactions from this forum.  In particular,
any discussion on the validity (or otherwise?) of the 2x2 at the end of the
piece would be welcome.

Many thanks
Dan


[1] https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/hypermedia-web/HcmS3zLohIg
[2] http://www.infoq.com/articles/Intro_Restful_Objects

--e89a8f646a07d776a604c542dbe7
